| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line229](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line229 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A spitting beetle is an insect in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It is most often seen when summoned by [priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") via [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects").

## Strategy

Spitting beetles are slow compared to most insects. They do a fair amount of damage, but not enough to make them that serious of a threat, especially when compared to [assassin bugs](/wiki/Assassin_bug "Assassin bug") or [migo queens](/wiki/Migo_queen "Migo queen"). Still, they should not be ignored if they are summoned right next to you. It is preferable to engage them in melee combat, as then they cannot use their acid attack, although it is not that damaging to begin with.
html:
Spitting beetle

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
a spitting beetle
Difficulty 17
Attacks Bite 4d6, Spits acid for 2d6
a spitting beetle
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Bite 4d6, Spits acid for 2d6

Base level 14
Base experience 384
Speed 6
Base AC -4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (93%)

A spitting beetle:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line229

A spitting beetle is an insect in SLASH'EM. It is most often seen when summoned by priests via summon insects.

Strategy

Spitting beetles are slow compared to most insects. They do a fair amount of damage, but not enough to make them that serious of a threat, especially when compared to assassin bugs or migo queens. Still, they should not be ignored if they are summoned right next to you. It is preferable to engage them in melee combat, as then they cannot use their acid attack, although it is not that damaging to begin with.

Spitting beetles are slow compared to most insects.  They do a fair amount of damage, but not enough to make them that serious of a threat, especially when compared to [[assassin bug|assassin bugs]] or [[migo queen|migo queens]].
